flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: Luminch One is an interactive lamp controlled by the movements of your hand. Wave your hand over it to turn it on or off, or move your hand up or down above it to change its brightness. Inside the lamp, an Arduino hooked to an infrared distance sensor tracks your hand and sets the state and the brightness of the LED lamp.
guide.introduction_rendered:
Luminch One is an interactive lamp controlled by the movements of your hand. Wave your hand over it to turn it on or off, or move your hand up or down above it to change its brightness. Inside the lamp, an Arduino hooked to an infrared distance sensor tracks your hand and sets the state and the brightness of the LED lamp.

Relevant parts
  • Infrared Proximity Sensor Long Range - Sharp GP2Y0A02YK0F
  • Infrared Sensor Jumper Wire - 3-Pin JST
  • Arduino Uno
  • Breadboard Mini Self-Adhesive
  • Electrolytic Decoupling Capacitor - 100uF/25V
  • Jumper Wires Premium 6" M/M Pack of 10
  • Luxeon Rebel High Power LED Breakout - Warm White
  • Break Away Male Headers - Right Angle
  • USB Cable A to B - 6 Foot
  • Wall Charger - 5V USB
  • Resistor 18 ohms 1W
  • Resistor 220 ohms 1/4W
  • NPN Transistor BC337
  • Short jumper wires (like the conductors from solid core UTP cable)
  • Heat shrink 3mm diameter (1/8 inch)
  • Balsa Wood Sheet 36" x 3/16" x 3"
  • Tracing Paper Sheet A4 110 to 200 gsm
Tools
  • Cutting mat
  • Hobby knife
  • Hot-glue gun
  • Masking tape
  • Pencil
  • Rule
  • Soldering iron
  • Swiss Army knife
  • White glue

lines.text: Cut three pieces of balsa wood of the following sizes: 77 mm x 77 mm, 70 mm x 70 mm, and 45 mm x 65 mm.

lines.text: Glue the 70x70 mm balsa square on the center of the 77x77 mm balsa square using the white glue.

lines.text: Let it dry for two or three hours under a heavy object like a large book.
lines.text_raw: Let it dry for two or three hours under a heavy object like a large book.

lines.text: Glue the Arduino on the center of the wood base using the hot-glue gun. Make sure the board of the Arduino does not stick out of the small square of the base. Only the USB connector of the Arduino must stick out of the small square.

lines.text_raw: Score the dashed lines with the point of the file tool of the Swiss Army knife or with another paper scoring tool.

lines.text: Remove the sheet from the cutting mat.

lines.text: Fold the sheet following the dashed and dot-dashed lines. Dashed lines are valleys and dot-dashed lines are mountains.
lines.text_raw: Fold the sheet following the dashed and dot-dashed lines. Dashed lines are valleys and dot-dashed lines are mountains.

lines.text_raw: Connect the other end of the USB cable to the USB wall charger.
